meanings.definition: A person who unlawfully occupies an uninhabited building or unused land.
meanings.sent1: The squatter was found living in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent2: The authorities removed the squatter from the empty lot.
meanings.sent3: The squatter thought the old mansion was a free hotel!
meanings.sent4: The squatter was like a silent ghost in the deserted building.
meanings.sent5: The image of the squatter in the rundown shack haunted the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To settle on unoccupied land without legal claim.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to squatter in the forest for the night.
meanings.sent2: People should not squatter on private property.
meanings.sent3: The birds seemed to squatter on the tree branches for a meeting.
meanings.sent4: The idea of love can squatter in unexpected hearts.
meanings.sent5: The seeds squatter in the fertile soil, waiting to grow into plants.
